name: Seva Mandir
briefDescription: Seva Mandir has been working for over forty years with rural tribal communities of Udaipur and Rajsamand Districts of Rajasthan. It is operational in 626 villages and 56 urban settlements. Its work has centred on efforts to bring together and organize fragmented communities through a wide variety of interventions across diverse sectors, thereby simultaneously addressing people’s immediate development needs and empowering them to become conscious agents of their own destiny. Seva Mandir’s workk focuses on a) building autonomous village institutions; b) enchancing people's capabilities in terms of health, education and gender equal relation; and c) creating sustainable improvements in livelihoods of people. In total the organization reaches out to 70,000 households influencing the lives of approximately 360,000 people every year.
